why: Gentle movement helps reduce pain sensitivity and keeps tissues mobile without overloading.

slides.title: Motion is Lotion
slides.content: Gentle movement helps reduce pain sensitivity and keeps tissues mobile without overloading

slides.title: Why It Works
slides.content: Movement increases circulation, reduces stiffness, and can calm the nervous system's pain response

slides.title: Gentle Movement
slides.content: Start slow and small; pain-free range only; focus on quality over quantity; listen to your body

slides.title: Evidence Base
slides.content: Research shows that gentle movement can reduce pain sensitivity and improve function in chronic pain conditions

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Movement makes pain worse. Fact: Gentle movement often reduces pain and stiffness.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: 5 minutes of gentle movement every hour; walking, stretching, or simple range of motion exercises
